decks.notes: The deck focuses on using aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the board and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It aims to apply pressure early on with efficient creatures like Boggart Trawler and Emperor of Bones while utilizing cards like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes powerful synergies with cards like Ephemerate and Flickerwisp to generate value and tempo advantage. Additionally, the inclusion of Relic of Progenitus and Solitude helps to further disrupt graveyard strategies and remove threats efficiently.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy with a combination of counterspells, discard spells, and removal. It aims to control the game by countering threats, removing problematic creatures, and disrupting the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Sink into Stupor. The deck also utilizes card advantage and selection with cards like Archmage's Charm and Preordain. Murktide Regent and Psychic Frog serve as finishers to close out the game once the opponent's resources have been depleted. The deck's mana base is optimized for consistency and flexibility.

This deck focuses on quickly building a board presence and overwhelming the opponent with cheap artifacts and creatures. The key to its strategy is to play numerous artifacts that grant additional benefits and synergies, such as mana acceleration and card draw, while also utilizing cards like Tormod's Crypt and Portable Hole to disrupt the opponent's game plan. By leveraging the affinity mechanic and utilizing powerful cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Urza's Saga, this deck aims to apply relentless pressure and close out the game quickly.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by disrupting the opponent's strategy with counterspells and removal spells while also drawing cards and generating card advantage. The deck aims to control the board and tempo of the game through efficient removal and disruption spells, allowing it to stabilize and take over the game in the mid to late game. By utilizing a mix of counter magic, removal spells, and card draw, the Dimir Control deck aims to out-value and out-control its opponents in order to secure victory.

The main concept of this deck is to aggressively play low-cost, high damage spells and creatures to quickly burn through the opponent's life total. By utilizing powerful burn spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Rift Bolt alongside efficient creatures like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear, the deck aims to deal consistent damage and pressure the opponent. Additionally, cards like Eidolon of the Great Revel provide extra punishment for the opponent casting spells. Overall, the deck's strategy is to attack fast and relentlessly to close out the game before the opponent can stabilize.

The deck focuses on utilizing the Twin combo with Deceiver Exarch to create infinite copies of a creature and win the game. It includes key cards like Splinter Twin, Force of Negation, and Psychic Frog to support the combo while also running disruption like Fatal Push and Dismember to control the board. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card advantage and Thundertrap Trainer offers additional win condition. The deck also includes various fetch lands and shock lands to ensure consistency in mana base and access to required colors.

The deck focuses on quickly cycling through cards to fill the graveyard and then casting Living End to bring all creatures back onto the battlefield, often overwhelming the opponent with a sudden tide of creatures. The deck also includes counterspells and disruptive creatures to control the game until the combo can be executed. The combination of card draw, graveyard manipulation, and powerful creatures allows the deck to consistently execute its game plan and win through explosive plays.

The deck focuses on a fast-paced aggressive strategy that utilizes disruptive creatures and spells to disrupt the opponent's game plan while building up a board presence. It aims to control the game by denying resources and neutralizing threats, while also applying pressure with efficient creatures. The deck's synergy comes from combining powerful creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Emperor of Bones with disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Prismatic Ending. By efficiently using removal and disrupting the opponent's strategies, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure a victory.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize the synergy between Amulet of Vigor, Primeval Titan, and various lands to generate massive amounts of mana and trigger powerful abilities. By using cards like Urza's Saga, Mycosynth Gardens, and Lotus Field, the deck can quickly ramp up to play Primeval Titan and search for key lands like Valakut, the Molten Pinnacle or Vesuva for additional copies. The deck also includes cards like Scapeshift and Cultivator Colossus to further enhance the combo potential and overwhelm opponents with a large number of threats.
